channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Westminster double murder: Victims named as police hunt continues
item.description: Sharon Pickles and Clinton Ashmore both died from a stab wound to the neck.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion erects table near Leicester Square
item.description: Extinction Rebellion activists are chained to the table in London in their latest mass protest.

item.title: Alta Fixsler should be allowed home for last moments of life, parents say
item.description: Alta Fixsler, who has been at the centre of a legal row, should be allowed to die at home, her father says.

item.title: Anthony Adekola murder: Three guilty of Marks & Spencer worker's killing
item.description: Anthony Adekola was stabbed by gang members who travelled to his postcode area looking for victims.

item.title: Man arrested as Katie Price taken to hospital
item.description: Police are called to reports of an assault in the early hours of Monday morning.

item.title: Euro 2020: Wembley steward who tried to sell final passes sentenced
item.description: Yusaf Amin tried to sell security passes, uniforms and wristbands to ticketless fans for Â£4,500.

item.title: Mission: Impossible request leads to Hollywood encounter
item.description: A request for an unnamed VIP to land in a garden leads to an encounter with Hollywood royalty.

item.title: Eileen Barrott death: Murder-accused husband appears in court
item.description: Mark Barrott is accused of murdering wife Eileen, who died at her home in Leeds on 15 August.

item.title: Brian Travers: UB40 saxophonist and songwriter dies at 62
item.description: The musician and songwriter was a founding member of the chart-topping reggae band.

item.title: Afghanistan: Veterans group sees sharp rise in counselling requests
item.description: The organisation has seen a fivefold rise in requests since the Taliban took control in Afghanistan.

item.title: Blackley rape: Dog walker, 17, attacked in Manchester park
item.description: The "horrendous" attack on the girl took place as she was walking through a park in Blackley.

item.title: Supt Gerry Richardson: Tribute to officer killed on duty 50 years ago
item.description: Supt Gerry Richardson was shot at point-blank range as he grappled with an armed robber in 1971.

item.title: Mission: Impossible train crashes into quarry in Stoney Middleton
item.description: Local photographers said the film's star Tom Cruise had been at the quarry to witness the crash.

item.title: Solihull friends' lockdown boredom turns horse box into pizzeria
item.description: Enterprising teenagers oversee the conversion to launch a mobile food business.

item.title: Ferrybridge chimney stacks demolished in controlled explosion
item.description: The controlled explosion takes place at a former coal-fired power station in West Yorkshire.

item.title: 'Race should not be a factor in my destiny'
item.description: A young Londoner beats 23,000 other entrants in one of the country's largest anti-racism competitions.

item.title: Teen gardener uses Instagram to promote mental health benefits
item.description: A teenager uses social media to encourage her peers to do more gardening to boost mental health.

item.title: RMT threatens strike action over legionella on trains
item.description: The RMT has launched a dispute after trace amounts of legionella were found in four trains' toilets.

item.title: Southampton FC refunds fans after St Mary's entry delays
item.description: Saints fans were left queuing outside the stadium, missing the start of the first home game of the season.

item.title: Grimsby: Four-year-old girl falls from moving car
item.description: The child is being treated for potentially life-threatening injuries, Humberside Police say.

item.title: Olympic boxer Ben Whittaker becomes Wolverhampton's mayor for a day
item.description: The silver medallist said in a post-bout interview in Tokyo he wanted to experience the honour.

item.title: From broken hip to my first Paralympics
item.description: Paralympic wheelchair basketball player Lucy Robinson wants to inspire others.

item.title: Mark Wood: England bowler out of third Test with shoulder injury
item.description: England bowler Mark Wood is out of the third Test against India because of a shoulder injury.

item.title: Premier League confirms 16 new positive Covid cases in latest round of testing
item.description: The Premier League says 16 players and club staff have tested positive for coronavirus over the past week.

item.title: Joe Root says it is 'difficult' to see Azeem Rafiq 'hurting'
item.description: Joe Root says it is "difficult" to see Azeem Rafiq "hurting" after he was the victim of "inappropriate behaviour" at Yorkshire.

item.title: Solheim Cup: Europe's Georgia Hall, Charley Hull and Mel Reid to face US
item.description: England's Georgia Hall, Charley Hull and Mel Reid are all in Europe's team for their defence of the Solheim Cup against the United States in September.

item.title: Isa, Bateman & Bentley face bans after derby
item.description: Wigan's Willie Isa is banned for four games after Friday's St Helens derby, with one-game bans for John Bateman and Saints' James Bentley.
